objective:
Objective:

Learn how to link labels and input fields properly using the labelFor property to improve accessibility, particularly for screen readers.
task:
Task:

You are given an initial code where a Label and an Input field are created but not properly linked.

Link the Label and Input properly.
instruction:
Instruction:

In the file /webapp/exercises/Exercise04.fragment.xml add the labelFor and textAlign properties in the Label control.
howToTest:
How to test:

  • Use NVDA (Screen Reader) to inspect the Input Control. It should vocalize the Label when the Input Control is focused.
  • In Chrome Inspector check that in <Label>, the For is linked to the Input Control.
helpCode:
<Label
  id="idFirstNameExercise04Label"
  width="150px"
  class="sapUiSmallMarginEnd"
  text="{i18n>Exercise04.fragment.label}"
  //Take a look at labelFor association for sap.m.Label control
  //Take a look at textAlign property for sap.m.Label control
/>
<Input id="idExercise04Input" />
